acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.49mg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipes) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2002)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From LD50 value >2,000 mg/kg (Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry report (Access on October 2008)) of the acute oral toxicity test (OECD TG 401, GLP) employing a rat, it was classified into "Not classified".

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made and there is no data, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there were no rapid degradability (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is description of "positive" in the in vitro mutagenicity test (chromosome aberration test using a Chinese hamster culture cells (CHL/IU) (OECD TG473, GLP)) (Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (Access on October 2008)), classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including oxygen, not fluorine and chlorine, this oxygen has not chemically bound to any elements other than carbon and hydrogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There is a report that "reproductive/developmental toxicity effects attributable to the administration of the substance in parents and their offspring were not observed until the highest dose of 1,000 mg/kg " in an reproductive/developmental toxicity screening oral administration test (OECD TG421, GLP) in rats (Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare Report (Access on October 2008)). However, in this study the data on teratogenicity in the offspring is insufficient. Since there is no other experimental data, classification is not possible.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is written in 28-day repeated oral administration test in rats (OECD TG407, GLP) that" there were no changes resulting from administration in behavioral function (FOB), sensory response, grip strength, motor activity, urine test, hematologic test, biochemical exam of blood, autopsy, and histological examination by administration of up to 1,000 mg/kg (90-day equivalent: 311 mg/kg) (Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare reports (Access on October 2008)). As mentioned above, it was classified into "Not classified ".

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There is a description of "Abnormalities were not seen in the general state and autopsy finding even if 2,000 mg/kg was administrated in male and female" in the acute oral toxicity test employing rats (OECD TG 401, GLP) (Health, Labor and Welfare Ministry reports (Access on October 2008)). As mentioned above, it was classified into "Not classified ".
